마법 아이템 IV (두루마리, 마법지팡이, & 마법막대)

MAGIC ITEMS IV (SCROLLS, STAFFS, & WANDS)

두루마리

SCROLLS

A scroll is a spell (or collection of 주문) that has been stored in written form. A spell on a scroll can be used only once. The writing vanishes from the scroll when the spell is activated. Using a scroll is basically like casting a spell.

Physical 묘사: A scroll is a heavy sheet of fine vellum or high-quality paper. An 범위 about 8 1/2 inches wide and 11 inches long is sufficient to hold one spell. The sheet is reinforced at the top and bottom with strips of leather slightly longer than the sheet is wide. A scroll holding more than one spell has the same width (about 8 1/2 inches) but is an extra foot or so long for each extra spell. 두루마리 that hold three or more 주문 are usually fitted with reinforcing 마법봉 at each end rather than simple strips of leather. A scroll has AC 9, 1 hit point, hardness 0, and a break DC of 8.

To protect it from wrinkling or tearing, a scroll is rolled up from both ends to form a double cylinder. (This also helps the user unroll the scroll quickly.) The scroll is placed in a tube of ivory, jade, leather, metal, or wood. Most scroll cases are inscribed with magic symbols which often 식별 the owner or 주문 stored on 두루마리 inside. The symbols often 숨기 마법 함정.

Activation: To activate a scroll, a spellcaster must read the spell written on it. Doing so involves several steps and 상태이상.

Decipher the Writing: The writing on a scroll must be deciphered before a character can use it or know exactly what spell it contains. This requires a 마법 읽기 spell or a successful 주문학 check (DC 20 + spell 레벨).

Deciphering a scroll to determine its contents does not activate its magic unless it is a specially prepared cursed scroll. A character can decipher the writing on a scroll in advance so that he or she can proceed directly to the next step when the time comes to use the scroll.

Activate the Spell: Activating a scroll requires reading the spell from the scroll. The character must be able to see and read the writing on the scroll. Activating a scroll spell requires no material 구성요소 or focus. (The creator of the scroll provided these when scribing the scroll.) Note that some 주문 are effective only when cast on an item or items. In such a case, the scroll user must provide the item when activating the spell. Activating a scroll spell is subject to disruption just as casting a normally prepared spell would be. Using a scroll is like casting a spell for 목적 of arcane 주문 실패 chance.

To have any chance of activating a scroll spell, the scroll user must meet the following 필요조건.

• The spell must be of the correct type (arcane or 신성). Arcane spellcasters (마법사, 소서러, and 음유시인) can only use 두루마리 containing 비전 주문, and 신성 spellcasters (사제, 드루이드, 성기사, and 레인저) can only use 두루마리 containing 신성 주문. (The type of scroll a character creates is also determined by his or her class.)

• The user must have the spell on his or her class list.

• The user must have the requisite ability score.

If the user meets all 필요조건 noted above, and her 시전자 레벨 is at least equal to the spell’s 시전자 레벨, she can automatically activate the spell without a check. If she meets all three 필요조건 but her own 시전자 레벨 is lower than the scroll spell’s 시전자 레벨, then she has to make a 시전자 레벨 check (DC = scroll’s 시전자 레벨 + 1) to cast the spell successfully. If she fails, she must make a DC 5 지혜 check to avoid a mishap (see Scroll Mishaps, below). A natural roll of 1 always fails, whatever the 수정치.

Determine Effect: A spell successfully activated from a scroll works exactly like a spell prepared and cast the normal way. Assume the scroll spell’s 시전자 레벨 is always the minimum 레벨 required to cast the spell for the character who scribed the scroll (usually twice the spell’s 레벨, minus 1), unless the caster specifically desires otherwise.

The writing for an activated spell disappears from the scroll.

Scroll Mishaps: When a mishap occurs, the spell on the scroll has a reversed or harmful effect. Possible mishaps are given below.

• A surge of uncontrolled magical energy deals 1d6 points of 피해 per spell 레벨 to the scroll user.

• Spell strikes the scroll user or an ally instead of the intended target, or a random target nearby if the scroll user was the intended recipient.

• Spell takes effect at some random location within spell 거리.

• Spell’s effect on the target is contrary to the spell’s normal effect.

• The scroll user suffers some minor but bizarre effect related to the spell in some way. Most such effects should last only as long as the original spell’s 지속시간, or 2d10 minutes for instantaneous 주문.

• Some innocuous item or items appear in the spell’s 범위.

• Spell has delayed effect. Sometime within the next 1d12 hours, the spell activates. If the scroll user was the intended recipient, the spell takes effect normally. If the user was not the intended recipient, the spell goes off in the general direction of the original recipient or target, up to the spell’s maximum 거리, if the target has moved away.

Several 비전 주문 are different in 레벨 for 소서러 and 마법사 than they are for 음유시인. Such 주문 appear on the table at 레벨 appropriate to a 소서러 or 마법사(considered the default because 음유시인 typically don’t involve themselves

in scribing 두루마리).

Likewise, some 신성 주문 are different in 레벨 for 사제 and 드루이드 than they are for 성기사 and 레인저. Such 주문 appear at 레벨 appropriate to a 사제 or 드루이드(considered the default because 성기사 and 레인저 typically don’t involve themselves in scribing 두루마리).

If a 신성 spell is cast at different 레벨 by 사제 and 드루이드, it appears at 레벨 appropriate to a 사제 (considered the default choice between 사제 and 드루이드).

Many 주문 are either arcane or 신성, depending on the class of the caster. Such 주문 appear on both lists at 레벨 appropriate to the class of the arcane or 신성 caster.

A staff is a long shaft of wood that stores several 주문. Unlike 마법막대, which can contain a wide variety of 주문, each staff is of a certain kind and holds specific 주문. A staff has 50 돌격 when created.

A typical staff is like a walking stick, quarterstaff, or cudgel. It has AC 7, 10 히트 포인트, hardness 5, and a break DC of 24.

To activate a staff, a character must hold it forth in at least one hand (or whatever passes for a hand, for nonhumanoid creatures).

마법막대

WANDS

A wand is a thin baton that contains a single spell of 4 레벨 or lower. Each wand has 50 돌격 when created, and each 돌격 expended allows the user to use the wand’s spell one time. A wand that 달리기 out of 돌격 is just a stick.

Physical 묘사: A typical wand is 6 inches to 12 inches long and about 1/4 inch thick, and often weighs no more than 1 ounce. Most 마법막대 are wood, but some are bone. A rare few are metal, glass, or even ceramic, but these are quite exotic. Occasionally, a wand has a gem or some device at its tip, and most are decorated with carvings or 달리기. A typical wand has AC 7, 5 히트 포인트, hardness 5, and a break DC of 16.

Activation: 마법막대 use the spell 트리거 activation method, so casting a spell from a wand is usually a standard action that doesn’t provoke 기회 공격. (If the spell being cast, however, has a longer 시전 시간 than 1 action, it takes that long to cast the spell from a wand.) To activate a wand, a character must hold it in hand (or whatever passes for a hand, for nonhumanoid creatures) and point it in the general direction of the target or 범위. A wand may be used while grappling or while swallowed whole.

특성: Roll d%. A 01–30 result indicates that something (a design, inscription, or the like) provides some clue to the wand’s function, and 31–100 indicates no 특성.
